Thank you, Taron. Look, I've got an idea that these catwalks lead to some sort of loading area on the surface. Check it out, will you?
Right. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Taron and Rebec leave.

Dialogue.Line: Right, get the bomb.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But a waking Dalek catches it with its sink plunger and knocks it down into the cavern.

Dialogue.Line: The bomb! Get down!
Where is it?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It is in the middle of a bunch of dozy Daleks. The Doctor climbs down from the catwalk, steps on Daleks and manages to retrieve it.

Dialogue.Line: Is it damaged?
The timing mechanism isn't functioning properly.
Can you fix it?
I think so. It'll take a minute or two.
Get on with it.
Doctor? Doctor, you're right. There is a power ramp. It goes up to ground level. I think we can climb it.
Good, good.
What are you planning to do, Doctor?

Well, this whole area is simply honeycombed with ice tunnels. Now, a bomb put in the right place could so weaken those walls that the pressure of the ice would burst through the walls and flood this entire chamber.
Bury the lot of them.
That's the theory.
But it won't destroy them, just put them back into their deep frozen state of suspended animation.
Yes, but it would centuries to melt them out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Latep reaches the bottom of the knotted rope and looks out to see the barricade starting to give way. Then Jo appears.

Dialogue.Line: You all right?
Yes, I think so.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They look out of the doorway.

Dialogue.Line: We've got to stop them.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Latep activates his bomb and slides it across the corridor floor to the barricade. A Dalek fires and misses him, then they all start to come through. Jo and Latep cover their heads as the bomb goes BOOM!
The corridor is a blackened mess with bits of Dalek strewn about.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, let's see if we can find the Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: More Daleks approach the far side of the breached barricade.

Dialogue.Line: They're here!
They're still coming, Doctor.
We did what we could though.
Well done, Jo.
Right, that's it.
Taron, you and the others get started. We'll set the bomb.
Yes. Come on, you two.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo and Latep leave with Rebec and Taron.

Dialogue.Line: Set it to detonate in thirty seconds.
Right. Detonator running now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pushes the bomb into the crevice.

Dialogue.Line: They're coming!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Daleks enter the Arsenal.

Dialogue.Line: Hurry up, Doctor! Hurry up!
Off you go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Codal leaves, then the Doctor follows. He joins the rest at the bottom of the ramp.

Dialogue.Line: Twenty seven, twenty eight

Dialogue.Stage Direction: KaBOOM! A Dalek and the catwalk are taken out.

Dialogue.Line: It failed! Come on, let's get out of here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A rumbling sound starts up.

Dialogue.Line: The ice volcano!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Liquid ice bursts through the cavern wall where the bomb weakened it, and floods down into the main body of the cavern.

Dialogue.Line: Out, everybody, out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor watches as the Dalek army is quickly engulfed.
The Dalek Supreme's aides report to him.

Dialogue.Line: Arsenal and all lower levels inundated. Molten ice rising through all sections. DALEK 2: No response from any Dalek unit. Total loss of contact.
Seal off all sections.
Not possible. Controls not responding. Total power source failure. DALEK 2: Sensors registering ice now advancing through upper levels!
Advise Supreme Command that our attack force is totally immobilised, and that we are the only survivors.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Liquid ice is pouring down the windows.

Dialogue.Line: Set self destruct on all instruments. We are abandoning! We are abandoning! We are abandoning! We are abandoning! We are abandoning!
There it is!
We can get home. Back to Skaro!
It's a bonus I never expected.
Jo, I must speak with you.
Doctor? I need to look over the controls of that ship.
Yes, of course.
So I. (pause) You've done a lot for me, Doctor. Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Codal salutes the Doctor by placing his left hand across his body to his right shoulder. The Doctor returns the gesture.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Codal leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, we'd never have succeeded without all your help. I wish there was some way of thanking you.
As a matter of fact, there is.
Yes, Doctor?
Throughout history, you Thals have always been known as one of the most peace loving peoples in the galaxy.
I hope we always will be.
Yes, well that's what I mean. When you get back to Skaro, you'll all be national heroes. Everybody will want to hear about your adventures.
Of course.
So be careful how you tell that story, will you? Don't glamorise it. Don't make war sound like an exciting and thrilling game.
I understand.

Tell them about the members of your mission that will not be returning, like Maro and Vaber and Marat. Tell them about the fear, otherwise your people might relish the idea of war. We don't want that.
You can depend on us.
Thank you, my dear. Well, you'd better get aboard, I think.
What about them?
I'm not sure about them. Goodbye, Rebec.
Goodbye, Doctor.
Taron?
Goodbye, Doctor.
Good luck.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Taron follows Rebec.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, I've asked Jo to come back to Skaro with me. Would you have any objections?
If that what she wants, no.
Well, Jo? Is it?
No, I'm sorry, Latep. Look, I'm very fond of you, but you see, I've got my own world and my own life to go back to.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo kisses Latep on the cheek and leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you, Doctor.
Thank you, Latep.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Latep enters the spaceship with a final wave, the hatch closes and it takes off.

Dialogue.Line: Right, shall we go and find the Tardis?
Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Dalek Supreme is arriving to find his ship has been stolen.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, run!
Aliens! Pursue! Pursue! Pursue! Pursue!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The squirt plants start up again.

Dialogue.Line: Wait! If those spores hit us
They're coming! Now cover your face and hands as best you can! Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jo stumbles.

Dialogue.Line: Jo, come on! Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They make it into the Tardis just before the Supreme opens fire. The Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Have Supreme Command send rescue craft.
I obey.
Preparations will begin at once to free our army from the ice. We have been delayed, not defeated. The Daleks are never defeated!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor flicks through various images on the scanner.

Dialogue.Line: Jo, look. That's Skaro.
Yes.
Any regrets?
No, not really.
But Jo, that's only one little world. There's so many hundreds of others to see.
There's only one little world I want to see right now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She changes the scanner image.

Dialogue.Line: That one.
That one? But, Jo, that's Earth.
That's right, Doctor. Home.
Home it is, Miss Grant.
